alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 6:54PM MDT until October 02 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The city of Carlsbad. * WHEN...Until 345 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roads, arroyos, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Some roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen and some additional amounts are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carlsbad, Carlsbad North and Living Desert State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
